etymology.description: Popular variant of 弔; an intermediate obsolete variant is 𨒝.
etymology.interpretation: A later popular graph that replaced 弔 in many contexts, likely for clearer structure by adding 口 under the vertical stroke while keeping the same reading and sense ‘hang/suspend’. In Simplified Chinese, it also doubles as the simplified form of 弔 in words like 吊唁.

examples.chinese: 把灯吊在天花板上(把燈吊在天花板上)。
examples.pinyin: Bǎ dēng diào zài tiānhuābǎn shàng.
examples.english: Hang the lamp from the ceiling.

examples.chinese: 桥上吊着红灯笼(橋上吊著紅燈籠)。
examples.pinyin: Qiáo shàng diào zhe hóng dēnglóng.
examples.english: Red lanterns are hanging on the bridge.

examples.chinese: 工人用绳子把机器吊起来(工人用繩子把機器吊起來)。
examples.pinyin: Gōngrén yòng shéngzi bǎ jīqì diào qǐlái.
examples.english: Workers used a rope to hoist up the machine.
